xxl.core.pipes.sinks
Interface Sink<I>

All Superinterfaces:
MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>, Node
All Known Subinterfaces:
Pipe<I,O>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractBufferPipe, AbstractGrouper, AbstractGrouper.Group, AbstractPipe, AbstractSink, AbstractTemporalPipe, AbstractTemporalSink, AbstractTimeStampPipe, AbstractTimeStampSink, Aggregator, BlockBasedBufferPipe, BufferPipe, Coalesce, CountBasedWindow, Counter, DevNull, Dropper, Filter, HashGrouper, HeapSorter, HeartbeatTests.TimeStampHBSource, IdentityPipe, IndexJoin, Join, Logger, Mapper, MultiWayEquiJoin, NestedTemporalWindow, PlanMigration.ReferencePointSplit, PlanMigration.ReferencePointUnion, PNAbstractSink, PredicateGrouper, PredicateSorter, Printer, ReservoirSampler, ResultCounterSink, Sampler, SinkCursor, Split, SWTSink, SWTSink.InternalSink, TemporalAggregator, TemporalDifference, TemporalDistinct, TemporalFilter, TemporalGroupAndAggregator, TemporalJoin, TemporalMapper, TemporalUnion, TemporalWindow, Tester, TimeGranularity, TimeStampIdentityPipe, Union, VisualSink
public interface Sink<I>
extends Node

The framework for query processing is based on dataflow graphs, therefore it consists of three fundamental types of components: sources, operators and sinks. Sources represent the initial components of a query graph whereas sinks act as terminal components. Operators can only appear 'inside' a query graph.

This interface models an arbitrary sink in a query graph. A sink continuously consumes elements streaming in from different sources, i.e., the sources call the sink's process method permanently. If a source runs out of elements, it calls the sink's done method.
An operator (interface Pipe) extends the interfaces Source and Sink, because on the hand it receives elements from its underlying sources and on the other hand it transfers its results to its subscribed sinks.

Since:
1.1

Method Detail

process

void process(I o,
             int sourceID)
             throws IllegalArgumentException
This method will be called in the transfer method of each source this sink got subscribed to. The element to be transferred will be sent to this sink selecting it as the first paramenter. The second parameter specifies the ID this sink used during its subscription. Therefore, the ID determines from which source this elements is from.
The element should not be cloned if it is transferred to multiple sinks which have been registered by a source. Due to performance reasons this source should rather use the same element and pass it to all subscribed sinks based on the assumption that these sinks will not perform any changes on this element, unless they clone it themselves.

Parameters:
o - The element streaming in.
sourceID - The ID this sink specified during its subscription by an underlying source.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the given element or ID is incorrect.

done

void done(int sourceID)
The method done is invoked, if the source with ID ID runs out of elements.

Parameters:
ID - The ID this sink specified during its subscription by an underlying source.

addSource

boolean addSource(Source<? extends I> source,
                  int sourceID)
                  throws SinkIsDoneException
Similar to the subscribe method of a source, this method establishes a connection between a sink and a source during runtime. The intention of both methods is to build up a double-linked query graph that is completely navigatable.
The method should be used to store a reference to the given underlying source together with the ID specified during this sink's subscription.

Parameters:
source - The source this sink got subscriped to.
sourceID - The ID this sinks used during its subscription by the specified source.
Returns:
Returns true, if the source has successfully been added, otherwise false.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.

removeSource

boolean removeSource(Source<? extends I> source,
                     int sourceID)
                     throws SinkIsDoneException
In conformity to the unsubscribe method of a source, this method removes the connection between a sink and a source on the sink's side. It removes the given source with ID ID from the internal datastructure used to store this sink's references to its sources.

Parameters:
source - The source this sink got subscriped to.
sourceID - The ID this sinks used during its subscription by the specified source.
Returns:
Returns true, if the remove operation was successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.

getSource

Source<? extends I> getSource(int index)
                              throws SinkIsDoneException,
                                     IllegalArgumentException,
                                     IndexOutOfBoundsException
Returns a reference to a source belonging to the specified index, i.e., the index which was returned for this source when the method addSource was called.

Parameters:
index - The index used to access sources in an internal datastructure of this sink.
Returns:
The source belonging to the specified index.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.
IllegalArgumentException - If no sources have been added.
IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified index does not exist.

getSourceID

int getSourceID(Source<? extends I> source)
                throws SinkIsDoneException,
                       IllegalArgumentException
Returns the first matching ID this sink used during its subscription by the specified source. This ID has already been stored, when the addSource method was invoked.

Parameters:
source - The source this sink got subscribed to.
Returns:
The ID this sink specified during its subscription.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.
IllegalArgumentException - If the specified sources has not been added.

getNoOfSources

int getNoOfSources()
                   throws SinkIsDoneException
Returns the number of sources that are currently connected with this sink.

Returns:
The number of sources.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.

isDone

boolean isDone()
If a sink is done, it will not receive further elements as all associated sources are done.

Returns:
Returns true, if the sink is already done, otherwise false.

receivedDone

boolean receivedDone(int sourceID)
Indicates whether this sink received done from the source with ID sourceID.

Parameters:
sourceID - ID of the source
Returns:
Returns true, if the sink received a done from the source with ID sourceID.
